# Tiinno UI - Quick Reference for AI

> Modern React component library with TypeScript, Tailwind v4, and accessibility-first design

## Stack

- React 19.2+, TypeScript 5.9+, Tailwind CSS v4
- Build: Vite, Turborepo, pnpm 9+
- Test: Vitest, React Testing Library
- Docs: Storybook

## Project Structure

```
tiinno-ui/
├── packages/
│   ├── ui/              # Component library
│   │   └── src/
│   │       ├── components/  # All components
│   │       ├── hooks/       # React hooks
│   │       ├── utils/       # Utilities
│   │       └── index.ts     # Public exports
│   └── mcp-server/      # MCP server (5 tools)
├── apps/
│   ├── docs/            # Storybook
│   └── playground/      # Dev sandbox
└── turbo.json
```

## 24 Components (6 Categories)

### Layout (5)
- Container: Responsive container with max-width
- Grid: CSS Grid with responsive columns
- Stack: Vertical/horizontal spacing
- Flex: Flexbox layouts
- Spacer: Flexible spacing

### Forms (6)
- Button: variants (primary, secondary, outline, ghost, danger), sizes (sm, md, lg)
- Input: Text input with error states
- Textarea: Multi-line input
- Select: Dropdown selection
- Checkbox: Boolean toggle
- Radio: Single selection

### Data Display (5)
- Card: Content container (default, outlined, elevated)
- Badge: Status indicators (success, warning, danger, info)
- Avatar: Profile images/initials
- Table: Tabular data (striped, hoverable)
- Spinner: Loading indicator

### Feedback (3)
- Alert: Contextual messages (dismissible)
- Toast: Temporary notifications
- Progress: Progress bar

### Overlay (3)
- Modal: Dialog overlay (sm, md, lg, xl)
- Popover: Contextual popup
- Tooltip: Hover hints

### Navigation (2)
- Tabs: Tabbed interface (line, enclosed, pills)
- Breadcrumb: Navigation hierarchy

## Component Pattern (CVA)

```tsx
import { forwardRef } from 'react';
import { cva, type VariantProps } from 'class-variance-authority';
import { cn } from '@/utils/cn';

// 1. Define variants
const buttonVariants = cva(
  'base-classes',
  {
    variants: {
      variant: { primary: 'classes', secondary: 'classes' },
      size: { sm: 'classes', md: 'classes', lg: 'classes' },
    },
    defaultVariants: { variant: 'primary', size: 'md' },
  }
);

// 2. TypeScript types
export interface ButtonProps
  extends React.ButtonHTMLAttributes<HTMLButtonElement>,
    VariantProps<typeof buttonVariants> {
  loading?: boolean;
}

// 3. JSDoc + Component
/**
 * Button component
 * @example <Button variant="primary">Click</Button>
 */
export const Button = forwardRef<HTMLButtonElement, ButtonProps>(
  ({ className, variant, size, loading, children, ...props }, ref) => {
    return (
      <button
        ref={ref}
        className={cn(buttonVariants({ variant, size }), className)}
        disabled={loading || props.disabled}
        {...props}
      >
        {loading ? 'Loading...' : children}
      </button>
    );
  }
);

Button.displayName = 'Button';
```

## Design Tokens

### Colors
```
Primary: bg-primary-{50-900}, text-primary-500
Neutral: bg-neutral-{50-900}, text-neutral-500
Semantic: success, warning, danger, info
Dark mode: dark:bg-*, dark:text-*
```

### Spacing
```
xs: 4px, sm: 8px, md: 16px, lg: 24px, xl: 32px, 2xl: 48px
Use: gap-md, p-lg, m-sm
```

### Border Radius
```
sm: 4px, md: 6px, lg: 8px, xl: 12px, 2xl: 16px, full: 9999px
```

### Typography
```
Sizes: text-{xs,sm,base,lg,xl,2xl}
Weights: font-{normal,medium,semibold,bold}
Line heights: leading-{tight,normal,relaxed}
```

## Accessibility Checklist

- ARIA attributes (aria-label, aria-describedby, role)
- Keyboard navigation (Enter, Space, Escape, Arrows)
- Focus management (focus-visible:ring-2)
- Screen reader support (aria-live, role="alert")
- Semantic HTML (button, input, nav, etc.)

## Testing Pattern

```tsx
import { render, screen, fireEvent } from '@testing-library/react';
import { Component } from './Component';

describe('Component', () => {
  it('renders correctly', () => {
    render(<Component>Test</Component>);
    expect(screen.getByText('Test')).toBeInTheDocument();
  });

  it('handles interactions', async () => {
    const onClick = vi.fn();
    render(<Component onClick={onClick}>Click</Component>);
    fireEvent.click(screen.getByText('Click'));
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalled();
  });

  it('supports variants', () => {
    const { container } = render(<Component variant="primary" />);
    expect(container.firstChild).toHaveClass('bg-primary-500');
  });
});
```

## MCP Server (5 Tools)

Located: `/packages/mcp-server/`

### Tools
1. **list-components**: Get all components by category
2. **get-component-info**: Detailed info for specific component
3. **search-components**: Find components by query/category
4. **get-design-tokens**: Get design system tokens
5. **generate-component-code**: Generate usage code

### Configuration
```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "tiinno-ui": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["path/to/mcp-server/dist/index.js"]
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Rules

1. ALWAYS use CVA for variants
2. ALWAYS use forwardRef for DOM elements
3. ALWAYS include TypeScript types
4. NEVER use inline styles (Tailwind only)
5. ALWAYS support dark mode (dark:*)
6. ALWAYS add ARIA attributes
7. ALWAYS write tests (>80% coverage)
8. ALWAYS export from src/index.ts

## Example Usage

```tsx
// Layout
<Container maxWidth="lg">
  <Grid cols={3} gap="lg">
    <Card variant="elevated">Content</Card>
  </Grid>
</Container>

// Forms
<form>
  <Input placeholder="Email" type="email" error={errors.email} />
  <Textarea rows={4} placeholder="Message" />
  <Flex justify="end">
    <Button variant="primary" loading={isSubmitting}>
      Submit
    </Button>
  </Flex>
</form>

// Feedback
<Alert variant="success" dismissible>
  Operation successful!
</Alert>

// Overlay
<Modal isOpen={isOpen} onClose={() => setIsOpen(false)} title="Confirm">
  <p>Are you sure?</p>
  <Flex justify="end" gap="md">
    <Button variant="ghost" onClick={() => setIsOpen(false)}>Cancel</Button>
    <Button variant="danger" onClick={handleDelete}>Delete</Button>
  </Flex>
</Modal>
```

## Anti-Patterns (Never Do)

```tsx
// ❌ Inline styles
<div style={{ color: 'red' }}>Bad</div>

// ❌ Type 'any'
const handleClick = (data: any) => {}

// ❌ No ARIA
<div onClick={onClick}>Click</div>

// ❌ Hardcoded values
<div className="w-[237px]">Bad</div>

// ✅ Correct
<div className="w-60 text-red-500" role="button" aria-label="Click me">
  Good
</div>
```
